content.description: As the name implies, a slippery slab with an insecure crux at the first bolt due to the polished nature of the rock. After that bigger holds start to appear and the climbing gets easier.
content.location: This climb is accessed either by scrambling up the vegetated gully at the far right end of the wall, or by climbing any of the adjacent routes to the left and walking down to it from the top.

content.description: Pull through a couple of overhangs and then continue up and right through a series of ramps to the top of the wall. Overall, a well protected route with interesting features on so-so rock. Because this route traverses quite a bit, descend by walking off the back of the wall.
content.protection:
Six bolts, cams to 2"

Bolted anchors

content.description: This long and nicely exposed route begins on the left side of the large tiered roof, about 30 ft to the left of Bucket Face. Climb up to a roof with a crack that takes good gear. After that, follow the bolted line to the top of the wall.
content.protection:
7 bolts, pro to 2"

To descend, use the rap anchors at the top of Bucket Face. a 70m rope barely reaches the ground.
content.location: Located on the left side of large tiered roof, left to the start of Bucket Face.
